intro: Lasiopetalum lineare, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens. Lasiopetalum lineare is also known for its ability to tolerate coastal conditions and salt spray.
